brief: This command fetches information about all DHCPv6 servers specified by the user.
cmd-comment: This command contains no arguments besides the optional ``remote``.
cmd-syntax: <specification of the database to connect to>
name: remote-server6-get-all
resp-comment: The returned response contain a list of maps. Each map contains a server tag uniquely identifying a server, and the user-defined description of the server. The Kea Configuration Backend uses the keyword ``all`` to associate parts of the configuration with all servers. Internally, it creates the logical server ``all`` for this purpose. However, this logical server is not returned as a result of the ``remote-server6-get-all`` command; only the user-defined servers are returned.
